chapter.title: Loan Example
chapter.para: This chapter presents an all-time BPM classic: loan approval. An individual or company in seek of funds applies for a loan in a financial organization. Small amounts are approved automatically. Large amounts are presented to an agent for further evaluation. The agent has the final word on approving or rejecting the loan.

Some variants of the example take into account the credit of the borrower. In this instance, however, that aspect was disregarded in favor of focusing on the human participation in the process. Neither BPEL4WS 1.1 nor WS-BPEL 2 specify an activity that allows direct people involvement. The present example demonstrates how to get people involved through a partner task management service.

The task management service introduced here builds upon the jPDL task management model. This solution has two advantages. First, it leverages a proven model and makes its facilities immediately available to client applications. Second, it shares database resources with jPDL processes.
